0.title: Reestablishing the Division of Culture and History as the Department of Arts, Culture and History
0.description: The purpose of this bill is to reestablish the Division of Culture and History as the Department of Arts, Culture and History, which shall be a separate independent agency within the Executive Branch. The Commissioner of Culture and History will become the Curator of Arts, Culture and History. The Curator reports directly to the Governor and represents the department as a full participating member in meeting of the cabinet secretaries convened by the Governor. Also, the Library Commission and Educational Broadcast Authority are to be organized within the department for administrative support.

1.title: Relating to the West Virginia Fire, EMS, and Law-Enforcement Officer Survivor Benefit Act
1.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the West Virginia Fire, EMS, and Law-Enforcement Officer Survivor Benefit Act as modified by Enrolled Committee Substitute for Senate Bill 625 to allow for a retroactive effective date of January 1, 2018, eliminate a one-payment requirement, and provide for a distribution consistent with intestate statutes if there is no beneficiary document by the decedent.Â

2.title: Relating to the management and inventory of state vehicles
2.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide technical cleanup and clarifying language to the 2018 House Bill 4015, which reformed the management of state vehicles.

3.title: Modifying the type of businesses and establishments required to post human trafficking assistance notices
3.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide clarifying language and addresses technical issues contained in Enrolled Committee Substitute for HB 4169 (2018). The bill modifies the type of business or establishments required to post human trafficking notices. It also modifies the criminal penalties for violating the section.

4.title: Relating to the Physical Therapy Licensure Compact Act
4.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the venue, enforcement and rulemaking sections of the Physical Therapy Licensure Compact Act (Enrolled Committee Substitute for SB 456) to conform with the provisions of the model act provided by the Physical Therapy Compact Commission to allow West Virginia to become a participating member.Â Otherwise, West Virginia cannot participate in the multi-state licensure compact.

5.title: Relating to securing a real estate deed by a purchaser of a tax lien
5.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend and adjust certain deadlines and timeframes relating to securing a real estate deed by a purchaser of a tax lien.

8.title: West Virginia Medical Cannabis Banking Act
8.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the Medical Cannabis Banking Act to provide banking services for the Medical Cannabis Act.Â Various definitions are provided.Â The State Treasurer is required to create a closed-loop system to accept moneys and payments.Â Vendors are required to comply with all federal, state and local laws, regulations and rules.Â Various requirements are established for the closed-loop system and matters the system should prohibit.Â The Treasurer is to authorize acceptable forms of payment, and to withdraw or transfer any amounts due the state.Â A financial institution under this Act is not required to be a state depository.Â Actions under this Act are not unlawful under any other provisions of the Code.Â The Commissioner of Financial Institutions is not to impair operations of any financial institution engaged under this Act.Â The State is to indemnify the Treasurer and employees of the Treasurer’s Office providing banking services in accordance with the Act.Â The Treasurer is authorized to charge fees and to deposit and expend those fees.Â Confidential information is exempt from disclosure pursuant to a FOIA request.Â All information is accessible by the Bureau of Public Health and law enforcement, and by others upon execution of a nondisclosure agreement.Â This Act shall control over the Medical Cannabis Act, and any proprietary interests in the closed-loop system are subject to the Uniform Unclaimed Property Act.
